posts.post_content: Can someone please tell me how to filter Deans out of Ebay. Thanks

[quote name="Eddiez" post=1806105]Can someone please tell me how to filter Deans out of Ebay. Thanks[/QUOTE]

On left side of the search is all of the categories and filters.
Click one of the "see all" links.
Near bottom of pop-up is "Seller", click it.
Click the only check box "Only Show items from:"
Click the first radio button "Specific seller ..."
Leave drop down as "Exclude", then enter 'deans_cards'
Click "Apply" on bottom right.

You've now excluded seller deans_cards from this specific search.

You can save these searches and dean's will always be excluded.
You just made my ebaying much more enjoyable.
Thank you Steve for the public service.

But where will I look for mediocre cards priced 10-50x higher than they should be? LOL

Thanks for the info, I had been looking for the same info not too long ago!
Haha, and those super saturated pics :D

that after my other filters (I only look at Piedmont, Old Mill and Hindu cards), using this trick, the number of cards left to look at this morning dropped from 8,867 to 7007. 

Guy has 1,860 cards listed? Sell them at a realistic price and he'd still make a fortune.

[quote name="Ed_Hutchinson" post=1806180]But where will I look for mediocre cards priced 10-50x higher than they should be? LOL

Thanks for the info, I had been looking for the same info not too long ago![/QUOTE]

well they do sell cards...and some cards  people jump to buy like when t206 green cobb,  rookie aaron's, rookie whoever when all of the sudden there was a price change that was not reflected in his prices....people can charge what they want...all i know a lot of dealers have left the business but he continues on....must be a reason..

In all fairness, Dean's isnt the only Ebay store with ridiculously high prices.  There are way too many to list. Its disappointing to see cards you want to buy, but the seller is so far out with pricing, making offers is a waste of time.

Totally agree with this. Was looking for a Fromme E-90 the other day and Dean's looked like a bargain compared to the others. That being said, it's a rarity when this happens.
